title: Winter's Rift causing FPS Lag
body:
The winter map is causing so much FPS lag for me, plus it's hurting my eyes.
I don't want to have to put up with this for the next few weeks cause it's making league unplayable.
Is there anything in the game files that can be changed to get rid of the map? They need to give an option to turn it off asap.

replies.body: All I will say about this winter map is that it is damn annoying and hurting my eyes. All that blue makes some abilties so hard to see

Unfortunately, there isn't an option to be able to swap back to the regular version of the map in-game. You may want to try messing with your monitor's brightness or contrast settings to make it more comfortable to look at.

As for the FPS issues you're having, this may be caused by corrupt or missing files for the snowdown map specifically, but it's hard to tell without more context on the issue. Most framerate issues can be fairly easily resolved by working through the steps in our [**FPS Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting), so I'd really recommend you go through those solutions for now.

Let me know if those steps caused any positive change for you.

I've been having FPS issues as well which I partially attributed to the death of my cpu fan but after replacing that the FPS lag continued. I was running around 9-40 FPS in any given match. I did find something that seems to help which was changing my processor power minimum. Not sure with other operating systems but Win10 seems to default it to 5% and upping it to 20-40% seemed to do the trick.

**Control Panel > All Control Panel Items > Power Options > Edit Plan Settings > Change advanced power settings > Processor power management >  Minimum processor state. 
**
Also realized my cooling policy was set to passive and changed that to active as well.

Note that changing this settings should not do any harm to your pc but it's not a terrible idea to reset them out of game to conserve power if you don't use hibernate settings. 

Hope this helps!
